revised_title: Elastic Hysteresis in Steel: A Comparative Study of High-Speed and Static Cycles
tldr: This study investigates the elastic hysteresis in steel under high-speed and static cycles. The research finds that hysteresis is likely within 5% the same at high speeds as at low speeds, and the shape of the hysteresis loop has been determined. The hysteresis in a hardened steel tube is only about one-eighth of the hysteresis in the same tube after annealing.
